docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES -- Midwinter is fastening its clutches on South America these days but there is still plenty of sunshine awaiting the traveler on this vast continent. The fact that Argentina and Chile can be frozen to the fur-coat stage while...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES -- Midwinter is fastening its clutches on South America these days but there is still plenty of sunshine awaiting the traveler on this vast continent. The fact that Argentina and Chile can be frozen to the fur-coat stage while norteamericanos are sweltering through July and August emphasizes the intercontinental contrast.

headline.main: OUR GOOD NEIGHBORS; The Spectacular Lands of South America Offer a Host of Fascinating Contrasts

docs.snippet: For the first time since the war created a world food shortage, a world surplus of grain above restricted needs loomed yesterday on the agricultural horizon.

docs.snippet: Thirteen Hunter College seniors majoring in speech have been gaining important clinical experience in the correction of speech disorders, as well as performing a valuable service to the community, Dr. Dorothy A. Doob, director of the speech clinic at...
docs.lead_paragraph: Thirteen Hunter College seniors majoring in speech have been gaining important clinical experience in the correction of speech disorders, as well as performing a valuable service to the community, Dr. Dorothy A. Doob, director of the speech clinic at the Long Island College Hospital and speech instructor at Hunter, announced yesterday.

headline.main: 13 HUNTER SENIORS AID SPEECH CLINIC; Practice on Youthful Patients at Long Island Hospital Held a Help in College Course

docs.snippet: If preliminary reports from the great grain-producing countries prove correct it may be feasible in the year ahead to end or substantially reduce bread rationing in Western Europe. Both official and private estimates agree that prospects of a grain...
docs.lead_paragraph: If preliminary reports from the great grain-producing countries prove correct it may be feasible in the year ahead to end or substantially reduce bread rationing in Western Europe. Both official and private estimates agree that prospects of a grain surplus have not been so promising since 1939.

docs.lead_paragraph: Demand that all meat exports to countries receiving aid under the European Recovery Program be stopped immediately was contained in a resolution passed unanimously yesterday by the New York State Association of Retail Meat Dealers at their annual convention in the Pennsylvania Hotel.

headline.main: MEAT EXPORT BAN IS AIMED AT ERP; Retail Group Votes Resolution for Action to Ease Upward Pressure on Prices
